body: `cc_library` targets can't be run with `bazel run` and `cc_binary` targets do not have a `hdrs` attribute. Could you fix the reproducer?

> `cc_library` targets can't be run with `bazel run` and `cc_binary` targets do not have a `hdrs` attribute. Could you fix the reproducer?

fixed.

issue.title: [6.4.0] cc_libaray target won't be rebuilt when header files are modified

milestone.title: 6.4.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved before the 6.4.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body: @dhmemi Are you still pushing this to be part of 6.4.0? The expected first release candidate date is next Monday (9/18/2023), just FYI. Thanks!

> @dhmemi Are you still pushing this to be part of 6.4.0? The expected first release candidate date is next Monday (9/18/2023), just FYI. Thanks!


No, According to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/discussions/19451, I solved the problem temporarily by installing English language package in VS and adding the environment variable `VSLANG`.

> @dhmemi Are you still pushing this to be part of 6.4.0? The expected first release candidate date is next Monday (9/18/2023), just FYI. Thanks!

We absolutely should as this is a correctness issue. If we don't fix it in time, we should roll back https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/17928 instead.

CC @meteorcloudy
